div.p: Austrian writer and author of screenplays, brother of the author and critic Ernst Lothar Müller.

Müller wrote his first stage plays while studying for the doctorate of law at the University of Vienna. From 1930 on, he lived in Einigen, Switzerland, spending some time also in Hollywood, where he worked as a script writer. He is known for his screenplay for The White Horse Inn (Im weißen Rößl, 1930), written with Robert Gilbert and Erik Charell, set to music by Ralph Benatzky. Earlier works were the libretto for Erich Wolfgang Korngold's Violanta (1916) and Das Wunder der Heliane (1927), based on works of Hans Kaltneker.
